The screenshot of a Tagalog: language news graphic by Philippine tabloid Abante Tonite stating that "Bicycles need to be registered" was shared on Facebook on February 9, 2021.
Comments from Facebook users on the post: expressing their disagreement and calling it corruption.
A search on the Facebook account of Aban: 2020, in a report about a local ordinance in Cebu City, not as a recent nationwide order from the Land Transportation Office (LTO).
Danilo Encela: assistant chief at LTO’s operations division, confirmed that there is no nationwide bicycle registration scheme implemented by the LTO, stating that ordinary bikes are not under their jurisdiction.
